resources.string: To properly test the solutions in this app, you need to enable \"Don\'t keep activities\", which is a system developer setting. \n\nOpen \"About phone\" in Settings, then scroll down to the bottom of the page and tap \"Build number\" seven times, or until developer options are enabled. Then return here.
This is required to properly test the solutions presented in this app. \n\nOpen \"Developer options\" and then toggle on \"Don\'t keep activities\" at the bottom of the page, then return here.

Done testing? Turn off \"Don\'t keep activities\" or your phone will be a bit slower and buggier than it would be otherwise. \n\nOpen \"Developer options\" and then toggle off \"Don\'t keep activities\" at the bottom of the page.

This app presents options for doing long-running tasks in the background. Each of the "Start" buttons in the cards below will kick off a background task that will last ten seconds. If the task completes and successfully communicates the result with the activity, a check mark will be displayed. 

A few ways to test these approaches: 

Wait for the task to complete without doing anything.

Background the app, wait for the task to complete, then return to the app. 
Background and foreground the app, then wait for the task to complete.

This approach will run the callback regardless of whether the activity is running. \n\nThis won\'t work if the activity is ever destroyed – the task won\'t be able to update state for a destroyed activity and won\'t have a reference to any new activity.

This approach will run the callback if the activity is running, but if it's not running it will save the result to disk so the activity can read it in onStart(). 

This will work if the activity is destroyed 
This won't work if the activity is re-created before the task completes – the task won't have a reference to the new activity

This approach will start a service that will run the task and store the result when complete. The activity will attempt to re-bind to this service when started, and if the service can be bound then the data will be read from it. 

This will work if the activity is destroyed 
This will work if the activity has been re-created
